themes: Need for data-driven impact reporting and accountability
Prioritization of public benefit and audience served in funding decisions
Panelist expertise and evaluation process reform
Support for professionalization and growth pathways for artists and organizations
Equitable grant allocation based on organizational capacity
Strengthening partnerships with arts service organizations
Creative space access and infrastructure support
key_phrases: lived experience expressed narratively in the application
not as an exclusionary eligibility threshold
enlightened panelists WHO HAVE ARTS EXPERTISE
Audience served must be the PRIMARY scoring factor
FINAL REPORTS must be detailed, provide links to legitimate backup
Artistic merit must be restored as the SECONDARY scoring consideration
ARTISTS PAID. How much? How many?
professionalizing pipeline structure for all arts grants
LARGE grants should be reserved for groups with the capacity already in place
inverse proportionality for institutional-level funding
Institutions that support the whole ecosystem should receive appropriate support
TALA can teach GAAP
Fiscal Sponsors must meet minimum standards
official collaborations between ACME Marketing and subsector arts services groups
Visit Austin is not collaborative
ATTRACT businesses into making arts philanthropy a priority
Creative spaces need City support and coordination
SpaceFinder-type searchable public database
Restore CSAP
Thrive needs fixing yesterday
barriers_identified: Lived experience used as exclusionary eligibility threshold
Lack of panelist expertise in relevant arts specialties
Insufficient review and incorporation of final reports
Funding gaps due to issues with Thrive program
Lack of clear, accessible creative space database
Visit Austin not serving Austinites well or collaborating
Creative spaces can't grow without funding
solutions_proposed: Allow lived experience to be expressed narratively in applications but not as an eligibility threshold
Recruit panelists with arts expertise in the specialty being evaluated
Make audience served the primary scoring factor
Require detailed, verified final reports and incorporate all into impact summaries
Restore artistic merit as a secondary scoring factor
Make artists paid a tertiary scoring factor, increasing grants for more artists paid well
Create a professionalizing pipeline structure for grants
Reserve large grants for organizations with demonstrated capacity and implement inverse proportionality for institutional funding
Develop strategic partnerships with arts service organizations (e.g., TALA teaching GAAP, fiscal sponsor standards)
Create official collaborations between ACME Marketing and arts service groups for information consolidation
Build mechanisms to attract business philanthropy to the arts
Develop a SpaceFinder-type public database for creative spaces, managed by a City employee
Fix Thrive program to prevent funding gaps
